thread.title: NU seeks revenge vs Warriors today
thread.title_full: NU seeks revenge vs Warriors today | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: Christian Jacinto
title: NU seeks revenge vs Warriors today
text:
by Christian Jacinto
October 10, 2015 Games Today
(Mall of Asia Arena)
2 p.m. – UP vs Adamson
4 p.m. – UE vs NU
If National University wants to salvage its title-retention bid, coach Eric Altamirano knows that his team must start picking up its game now.
The defending champion Bulldogs look to exact revenge on the University of the East Red Warriors and open their second round campaign on a positive note today in the UAAP basketball tournament at the Mall of Asia Arena.
NU had actually recovered from a 0-3 start when it won three straight games but saw its form dropped after falling 83-76 last Wednesday to co-leader Far Eastern University at the Smart Araneta Coliseum.
That put the Bulldogs in fifth place at midseason with a 3-4 record, that is why Altamirano has urged his players to step up in the most critical phase of the elimination round.
“Every game is crucial. We need every game we can get,” said Altamirano. “We’re still upbeat. We want to stay positive. There’s no point dwelling in the past.”
They hope to use the Red Warriors, losers of the past four games, as an instrument in their quest to begin another winning run.
NU is also out to avenge its 76-71 loss to UE in the first round when rookie transferee Bonbon Batiller came through with big baskets.
